description.narrative: The most significant expected project-level outcome for the project is access to finance for MSMEs to support economic activity and resilience in the aftermath of the COVID-19 crisis. Beyond the project outcome, IFC anticipates that the Project will support resilience amongst microfinance and BOP finance providers, catalyzing investments in the sector by demonstrating the viability of lending to BoP providers and crowding in other sources of international and domestic finance in support of these lenders.

The proposed project consists of an up to US$45 million senior loan to subsidiaries of Platcorp Holdings Limited, namely Platinum Credit Kenya, Premier Credit Kenya, Platinum Credit Uganda and Premier Credit Uganda. IFCs Own Account will be up to US$20mn in Kenya and up to US$5mn in Uganda, with the remaining US$20mn mobilized for the Kenya entities through B1/Parallel loans on a best-effort basis. The transaction aims to provide liquidity to the MFIs to support the growth of their MSME portfolio. The Project will be processed under the Base of the Pyramid (BOP) Program to support the growth of the MFIs micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSME) portfolio and the Uganda subsidiaries will benefit from a 40% Pooled First Loss Guarantee (PFLG).
